The crystals may be shattered by attacking them. The crystals have an AC of 8 and 3 hit points per 5-foot square covered. Otherwise, the crystals instantly retract when this dagger is pulled from the ground.
This feature may be used twice per long rest.

item.name: Elianim, The Dawnspark
item.reqAttune: by a cleric or paladin
entries: This ancient {@item warhammer|phb}, forged in the storms of the waning years of the Dawn War, was granted to the paladins of {@deity Pelor|dawn war|dmg} by {@deity Kord|dawn war|dmg} to aid in their fight against {@deity Tharizdun|dawn war|dmg}. Very few were bestowed, and even fewer still survive to the present day.
You have a +4 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. It has the following additional properties.

entries.name: Fury of the Storm
entries: Elianim deals an extra {@damage 1d4} lightning and {@damage 1d4} thunder damage on hit.

entries.name: Heart of the Sun
entries: While attuned to this weapon, your Constitution score increases by 2.

entries.name: Aura of the Dawn
entries: This weapon sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. This light may be suppressed at will (no action required). This light is sunlight.
While this light is visible, you and all allies within 20 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against becoming {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Mercy of the Rain
entries: This hammer holds 3 charges of crystallized light within the head. Whenever you cast a healing spell, you can expend one charge to heal one target for an extra {@dice 2d6} hit points. All three charges are restored at dawn.

item.name: Fang of the Gatekeeper
entries: This {@item dagger|phb} seems to endlessly seep blood from the hilt, though the fluid never drips from the blade.

entries.name: Bite of the Hound
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. The additional damage is necrotic.

entries.name: Guardian of the Afterlife
entries: This weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d4} piercing damage to humanoid or undead creatures.

entries.name: Master's Command
entries: Whenever you make a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) check while attuned to this dagger, you may add an additional {@dice 1d6} to the roll. In addition, depending on the roll, one of the following effects manifests for a few moments.

rows: Your voice deepens and resonates loudly
All light within 10 feet of you darkens

item.name: Gauntlet of Adni
entries: Touching anything with this soft purple glove feels like it isn't even there—you can feel everything perfectly well.

entries.name: Touch of Life
entries: When you deal damage with an unarmed strike, that damage is dealt as radiant damage instead of bludgeoning.

entries.name: Protector of the Living
entries: You can use this glove to cast {@spell spare the dying} at will.

entries.name: Lifegiver
entries: As an action, you can point to a creature you can see within 90 feet. You suffer {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage, and the target heals a number of hit points equal the damage you took. Once this feature has been used, it can't be used again until the end of your next long rest.

entries.name: Gauntlets of Mortality
entries: When you are attuned to both the Gauntlet of Adni and the {@item Gauntlet of Vesz|RotR3}, they count as a set and take only one attunement slot. The {@i Gauntlets of Mortality} are considered Very Rare.
Additionally, at the end of each long rest you gain temporary hit points equal to 10 + your character level.

item.name: Gauntlet of Vesz
entries: Upon donning this firm purple gauntlet, nearly all sensation is shut out on that hand.

entries.name: Touch of Death
entries: When you deal damage with an unarmed strike, that damage is dealt as necrotic damage instead of bludgeoning.

entries.name: Death Caller
entries: You can use this glove to cast {@spell true strike} at will.

entries.name: Lifetaker
entries: As an action, you can point to a creature you can see within 90 feet. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or suffer {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage. You heal a number of hit points equal the damage inflicted. Once this feature has been used, it can't be used again until the end of your next long rest.

entries.name: Gauntlets of Mortality
entries: When you are attuned to both the {@item Gauntlet of Adni|RotR3} and the Gauntlet of Vesz, they count as a set and take only one attunement slot. The {@i Gauntlets of Mortality} are considered Very Rare.
Additionally, at the end of each long rest you gain temporary hit points equal to 10 + your character level.

item.name: Gloves of the Verdant Sentry
item.reqAttune: by a monk
entries: These green gloves each have one half of a shield emblem emblazoned on the back.

entries.name: Reinforced Strikes
entries: While attuned to these gloves, you gain a +1 bonus to all attack and damage rolls made for your unarmed strikes.

entries.name: Clasp of Protection
entries: You can snap the half-shields on these gloves together as a reaction, summoning an invisible barrier around you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +2 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from {@spell magic missile}.
You can use this ability three times per long rest.

entries.name: Broken Seal
entries: When you attack after using the {@i Clasp of Protection} feature, your first unarmed strike with each hand deals an extra {@damage 1d4} force damage.

item.name: Greataxe of the Hills
entries: This heavy greataxe features a curiously extended handle, with reinforcements along the body.

entries.name: Heavy Hitter
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Over-axe-tended
entries: Before making an attack roll with this weapon, you can choose to take a −3 penalty to the attack roll to gain the {@i Reach} property.

item.name: Halberd of the Northern Tribe
entries: The handle of this halberd feels cool to the touch, even in warm environments.

entries.name: Northern Smithing
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Frost Guardian
entries: While attuned to this weapon, you have resistance to cold damage and do not suffer any impairments (or gain levels of {@condition exhaustion}) from cold weather conditions.

entries.name: Frostbite
entries: On a successful hit from this weapon, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take an additional {@damage 1d4} cold damage.

item.name: Hood of the Dragon Turtle
entries: Made to resemble {@creature dragon turtle||its namesake} and crafted from the scales and hide of the same, the gems embedded in each eye socket glow slightly when near a body of water.

entries.name: Fortitude of the Deep
entries: While you are attuned to this hood, you gain a +4 bonus to your Constitution score, to a maximum of 22.

entries.name: Dark Ocean Ancestry
entries: You gain {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 120 feet while attuned to this hood. In addition, you are able to breathe both water and air.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: As an action, you can exhale steam in a 20-foot cone. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} fire damage, taking half damage on a success. This damage increases to {@damage 3d8} at 6th level, {@damage 4d8} at 11th level, and {@damage 5d8} at 16th level. Being underwater does not provide any protection from this feature.
Once this feature has been used, it cannot be used again until the end of your next short or long rest.

itemGroup.name: Runechalk
entries: This simple piece of chalk has been imbued with arcane power that can be released by drawing different shapes on surfaces.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the adraloth's darkvision.

trait.name: Many Eyes
entries: The adraloth can see in all directions at once and has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Nimble
entries: The adraloth can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The adraloth makes three attacks with its blades.

action.name: Blades
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Eyes of the Abyss
entries: The adraloth shoots three rays out of eyes to targets it can see within 90 feet: an {@i Abyssal Ray} from the center eye and two {@i Blinding Rays} from their many other eyes. Each ray must target a different creature.

{@b Abyssal Ray.} A ray of silvery magic shoots out from the adraloth's center eye. The targeted creature must make a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 14}), taking {@damage 3d10} psychic damage on a failed save. If the target fails their saving throw by more than 5 they also become vulnerable to psychic damage for 1 hour. A creature immune to psychic damage becomes resistant, and a creature resistant to psychic damage loses its resistance.

{@b Blinding Ray}. A bright yellow ray shoots out of one of the many other eyes of the adraloth. The targeted creature must make a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 14}) or become {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn.

The demonic abominations known as adraloth are feared across the realms for their ruthlessness. Onyx growths cover their forearms and speckle the skin of their body. Blades are affixed to the growths on their arms, turning their body into a weapon. These bladed arms, their innate ocular abilities, and their talent for stealth, combined with their disregard for life have given them the reputation of cold-blooded and fierce killers.

entries.name: Eyes in the Dark
entries: Adraloths will prey on creatures separated from their group or pack and will almost always attack under the cover of darkness. Often catching their targets by surprise, their writhing mass of eyed tentacles has been confused for multiple creatures by the unfortunate souls who have encountered an adraloth.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the aumleaf remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary leaf.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The aumleaf can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} actions as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The aumleaf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the aumleaf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The aumleaf's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 11}). The aumleaf can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Scratch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 slashing damage. The target must make a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or take an additional {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage.

action.name: Razor Leaves
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) slashing damage.

variant.name: Brightpetal Aumleaf
entries: A {@i brightpetal aumleaf} is a brightly-colored variant of the aumleaf with a stronger connection to their innate magic. The brightpetal aumleaf is an aumleaf with the following changes:

Their Dexterity is 10 ({@i Scratch} +2 to hit), their Wisdom is 16 (spell save {@dc 13}, {@i Razor Leaves} +5 to hit, 9 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage), their AC is 10, and they can cast {@spell entangle} twice per day.

The aumleaf is an extremely small fey creature that looks like a fallen leaf. Despite their slightly frightening visage they are actually quite friendly. Known to befriend various forest creatures as well as {@creature treant||treants}, these leafy fellows feel most at home on the forest floor.

entries.name: Community
entries: Aumleaves usually live in small tribes deep in the forest, far away from civilization. Aumleaves take care of the forest and work hard in the fall season to prepare the forest and its denizens for the cold of winter. Because of this, aumleaves tend to befriend many insects and small animals. An aumleaf is not easily angered but they are known to be extremely protective of the environment, their pets and each other.

entries.name: Unnoticed
entries: It is pretty hard to spot an aumleaf, especially in the fall season. Not only does their natural camouflage hide them in plain sight, but their innate magical abilities help them to blend in to their surroundings perfectly.

trait.name: Air Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Swirling Debris
entries: If a creature starts its turn in the elemental's space, it takes {@damage 2d6} slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks or uses its {@i Cutting Gusts} ability twice.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Cutting Gusts
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Autumn Storm {@recharge 4}
entries: Each creature within 5 feet of the elemental must make a Strength saving throw ({@dc 13}). On a failed save, a target takes 15 ({@damage 3d8 + 2}) thunder damage and is flung up 20 feet away from the elemental and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw ({@dc 13}) or take the same damage and be knocked prone. If the saving throw is successful, the target takes half the thunder damage and isn't flung away or knocked prone.

Autumn elementals are a type of {@creature air elemental} that have absorbed a great amount of fallen leaves and dirt off the ground in the stormy fall season. Because of this, an autumn elemental is slightly more tumultuous, volatile and dangerous than a regular air elemental.

entries.name: Howling Winds
entries: What really sets these elementals apart is the sounds of howling winds they make. These sounds are often mistaken for ghosts or spirits which causes people to believe that locations where an autumn elemental resides are haunted.

trait.name: Bad Luck
entries: The cait sidhe can use its reaction to force one creature it can see within 30 feet to have disadvantage on their next attack roll or ability check.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cait sidhe's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). The cait sidhe can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cait sidhe makes three claw attacks or two attacks with {@i Fey Claw}.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fey Claw
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 90 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

variant.name: Wild Cait Sidhe
entries: This particular type of cait sidhe is larger and slightly more dangerous than their smaller counterparts. These variants are most often seen in the feywild, rather than the material plane. A {@i wild cait sidhe} is a cait sidhe with the following changes:

Their size is Medium, they have 110 ({@dice 20d8 + 20}) hit points, their CR is 6 (2300 XP), their claw attack deals 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, their Fey Claw attack deals 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage. Additionally, the wild cait sidhe can cast {@spell plane shift} once per day, targeting itself.

A cait sidhe is a fey creature that looks like a large black cat with a white spot on its chest. There are many different stories about these creatures that all differ wildly across cultures and kingdoms. What is made perfectly clear in all these stories, however, is that a cait sidhe can be incredibly dangerous if you are careless enough to displease them.

entries.name: Friend or Foe
entries: The cait sidhe is a solitary creature that roams both the material plane and their native plane, the feywild. Sometimes they befriend other intelligent fey or humanoids if they are exceptionally kind to the cait sidhe. Their trust is not easily lost, but if it is, it will never be regained.

monster.name: Candle Guard
languages: understands one language known to its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Flame of Life
entries: If the candle guard's wick is extinguished, they become {@condition paralyzed} after {@dice 1d4} rounds. The candle guard is otherwise immune to being paralyzed. If the candle guard takes fire damage from any source, the wick is relit and it is no longer paralyzed.

trait.name: Beacon of Light
entries: While the wick of the candle guard is lit, it sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The candle guard's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 10}). The candle guard can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or verbal components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The candle guard makes two {@i Snuffer Maul} attacks.

action.name: Snuffer Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

These wax-headed constructs are ever vigilant, standing ready until the moment they are lit. Candle guards are protectors by design and are often seen in the service of people who think hiring, feeding, housing, and trusting humanoid guards is not the best option. In some places in the world, candle guards are used exclusively as night guards to allow a full night of rest for their humanoid counterparts.

entries.name: Bringers of Light
entries: Candle guards are humanoid-sized constructs that are made to protect a place or person. The enchantments by which they are animated allows them to perform some small feats of magic. This grants them the ability to repair minor damage they sustain, keep their own flames lit, and ignite other candle guards in case it is required or ordered.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage. On a succesful hit, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 14}) or contract the disease {@disease grexialis|ba}.

Grexian hornets are often found in tropical climates. This hornet can grow up to 4 inches long from head to stinger and lives in small hives of up to 150 individuals. Their hives are built on rocky cliff sides and trees and consist of layers of plant fibers. In the center of this hive lives the queen, an immobile specimen that lays eggs and feeds the young.
Coming across a few hornets is no problem for the average adventurer, but fighting {@creature swarm of grexian hornets|ba|an entire hive} without the proper equipment or magic may prove troublesome.

entries.name: Disease Vector
entries: Grexian hornets are the main vector for {@disease grexialis|ba}, a disease that invokes hallucinations and impairs higher brain functions.

entries.name: Omnivores
entries: Grexian hornets have a diet that consists mainly of fruits and are particularly attracted to citrus fruits. However, grexian hornets have been known to scavenge the remains of corpses and consume flesh. Small mammals and birds sometimes fall prey to a swarm of agitated grexian hornets—though this is very rare.

entries.name: Territorial and Angry
entries: It is easy to stay clear of a hive of grexian hornets. One need only keep an ear out for the characteristic deep buzzing sound. If a person were to wander near a hive they can expect to be instantly attacked by the hornets inside. Individual hornets or hornets far away from the hive are only aggressive when agitated or disturbed.

action.name: Stings
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6 + 1}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. On a succesful hit, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 16}, or {@dc 14} if the swarm has half its hit points or fewer) or contract the disease {@disease grexialis|ba}.

Grexian hornets are often found in tropical climates. This hornet can grow up to 4 inches long from head to stinger and lives in small hives of up to 150 individuals. Their hives are built on rocky cliff sides and trees and consist of layers of plant fibers. In the center of this hive lives the queen, an immobile specimen that lays eggs and feeds the young.
Coming across {@creature grexian hornet|ba|a few hornets} is no problem for the average adventurer, but fighting an entire hive without the proper equipment or magic may prove troublesome.

entries.name: Disease Vector
entries: Grexian hornets are the main vector for {@disease grexialis|ba}, a disease that invokes hallucinations and impairs higher brain functions.

entries.name: Omnivores
entries: Grexian hornets have a diet that consists mainly of fruits and are particularly attracted to citrus fruits. However, grexian hornets have been known to scavenge the remains of corpses and consume flesh. Small mammals and birds sometimes fall prey to a swarm of agitated grexian hornets—though this is very rare.

entries.name: Territorial and Angry
entries: It is easy to stay clear of a hive of grexian hornets. One need only keep an ear out for the characteristic deep buzzing sound. If a person were to wander near a hive they can expect to be instantly attacked by the hornets inside. Individual hornets or hornets far away from the hive are only aggressive when agitated or disturbed.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the hartindeef's darkvision.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hartindeef makes two attacks with its claws or makes one claw attack and uses {@i Eyes of Anguish} once.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 3d6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Eyes of Anguish
entries: The hartindeef forces a creature it can see within 60 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw ({@dc 15}) or take 24 ({@damage 6d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Curse of the Anguished Heart (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The hartindeef uses {@i Eyes of Anguish}, but on a failed save the creature is also cursed with a deep sadness and heartache (for something or someone they have lost). The creature drops their weapons, lets out a cry of anguish until the end of their next turn, and falls {@condition prone}. While the curse is active the creature has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws, Charisma ability checks and Charisma saving throws. When the creature stands from being prone, they spend all their movement doing so.
The creature can reapeat their Wisdom saving throw whenever it finishes a long rest, ending the effect on a success.

Hartindeeves are notorious for clawing out the hearts of their prey. They place the heart in a cavity in their chest, where it starts beating again. It is believed this is how the hartindeef sustains itself as they have no way of consuming food or drink. Those who have survived a fight with a hartindeef swear that they could see the heart beating within its gruesome chest.

entries.name: Demon of Grief
entries: A hartindeef feeds off the grief and sadness in humanoid hearts. As such, they are often drawn to the heartbroken and bereaved.

entries.name: Eyes of Loss
entries: The eyes of a hartindeef are a dangerous weapon. {@condition blinded||Blinding} the hartindeef can prevent it from using this powerful gaze. Alchemists have used the eyes of a hartindeef for potions that fortify the mind and modify the memory to erase feelings of grief. There is a strong superstition among some peoples that consuming such a potion attracts more demonic creatures to them. Because of this, it is not common practice to create or consume these potions and is only done so as a last resort.

monster.name: Leech
senses: blindsight 20 ft. ({@condition blinded||blind} beyond this radius)

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The leech can breathe air and water.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage and the leech attaches to the target. While attached in this way, the leech doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of its turns, the target loses {@damage 1d4} hit points due to blood loss.

The leech can detach itself by spending 5 feet of movement on its turn. It automatically does so after the target loses 8 hit points or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use an action to carefully detach the leech.

Leeches can be found swimming through murky waters and crawling through the mud. In some places people even use them for medical purposes. Their {@creature giant leech|ba|gigantic variation} is often encountered in swamps and sometimes on other planes of existence where the planar magic changes their physical size.

entries.name: Swarms
entries: Leeches are often encountered in groups.

monster.name: Giant Leech
senses: blindsight 30 ft. ({@condition blinded||blind} beyond this radius)

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The leech can breathe air and water.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, they must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be swallowed.

action.name: Swallow
entries: A swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the leech, and it takes 6 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing and 6 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage at the start of each of the leech's turns. The leech can have only one target swallowed at a time.
If the leech dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

{@creature leech|ba|Leeches} can be found swimming through murky waters and crawling through the mud. In some places people even use them for medical purposes. Their gigantic variation is often encountered in swamps and sometimes on other planes of existence where the planar magic changes their physical size.

entries.name: Swarms
entries: Leeches are often encountered in groups. Giant leeches, however, often hunt alone or in packs of 3.

entries.name: Horrific Teeth
entries: Unlike its smaller counterpart, a giant leech tends to swallow a creature whole to drain it of its blood. For this purpose the entire inside of the leech is lined with rows of sharp teeth.

monster.name: Lindwyrm
senses: darkvision 20 ft. ({@condition blinded||blind} beyond this radius)

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The lindwyrm can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lindwyrm makes three attacks, one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

variant.name: Spiked Lindwyrm
entries: A {@i spiked lindwyrm} is a mutated strain of the species in which bonelike spines grow along the length of the body. The lindwyrm has learned to use these to its advantage and gains the following additional action:

entries.name: Tail Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 6 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage.
A spiked lindwyrm can choose to use their {@i Tail Slam} as part of their multiattack instead of a bite attack.

Deep underground, in damp tunnels and muddy caverns dwell the draconic creatures known as lindwyrms. These pale, slimy creatures employ their sharp teeth and claws to catch their prey by surprise in the complete darkness of their habitats. Lindwyrms are not as smart as their winged cousins, but they are extremely vicious and territorial. When a lindwyrm is threatened, it will most likely fight to the death in a blind fury of claws and teeth.

entries.name: Disgusting Lair
entries: A lindwyrm does not consume its prey fresh. It kills its victim and lets it rot for at least a week in its lair. Pools of fetid and acidic water are a place of rest for the lindwyrm, sleeping just below the surface. If anything enters the lindwyrm's lair, it will sneak through these pools to ambush the intruder.

monster.name: Pumpkin Ooze
senses: darkvision 60 ft. ({@condition blinded||blind} beyond this radius)

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The pumpkin ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Gourd Absorb
entries: When the pumpkin ooze moves into the space of a pumpkin, gourd, or other squash, it is absorbed by the ooze and the pumpkin ooze gains {@dice 2d6 + 4} temporary hit points.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Ooze Touch
entries: The pumpkin ooze touches a pumpkin, gourd, or other squash within 5 feet of itself and imbues it with necrotic energy. The pumpkin turns into an independent pumpkin ooze after {@dice 1d4} rounds that acts on the same initiative count as the parent ooze. The new ooze's maximum hit points are halved for the first 24 hours following its creation.

variant.name: Royal Pumpkin Ooze
entries: Sometimes, when a pumpkin ooze absorbs a great number of pumpkins, it turns into the greater {@i royal pumpkin ooze} (sometimes called a {@i pumpkin spice ooze} due to its distinct smell). The royal pumpkin ooze is a pumpkin ooze with the following changes:
Its size becomes Large and its CR increases to 3 (700 xp). It has 142 ({@dice 15d10 + 60}) hit points. Additionally, it gains the following action option.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries: The royal pumpkin ooze makes three pseudopod attacks and uses {@i Ooze Touch} once.

Jack 'o lanterns and pumpkins that are left out to rot have a chance to turn into a goopy animate slime known as a pumpkin ooze. Whether this happens because of wild magic surges or because a pumpkin came into contact with another type of ooze is unknown.

entries.name: Pumpkin Plague
entries: The biggest problem with these oozes is that they tend to infect other pumpkins, turning them into more oozes. It is not uncommon for a single pumpkin ooze to multiply into dozens during celebratory harvest seasons.

trait.name: Sand Form
entries: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the elemental remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from ordinary sand.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dune's Embrace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or become {@condition grappled} by the elemental. Until the grapple ends, the target is also considered {@condition restrained}. The elemental may have up to 3 creatures grappled this way.

In arid deserts and sun-scorched wastelands, adventurers may encounter sand elementals. These creatures are related to the more common {@creature earth elemental}, but their general demeanor tends to be softer. Sand elementals usually do not actively seek confrontation, but stepping on (or rather in) one may provoke it. Because of their physicality, it is not uncommon for sand elementals to be mistaken for quicksand.

entries.name: Nomads and Wanderers
entries: Sand elementals are not known to guard locations or stay in one place for very long. In contrast to most creatures that seek water and shade, a sand elemental will always try to be in the heat of the sun and avoid water for as long as possible. This behavior explains daily and seasonal movements of sand elementals. Those familiar with this behavior have even used it to their advantage to find their way in the desert and move toward sources of water.

entries.name: Aquaphobia
entries: It is rare to encounter a sand elemental in a subterranean environment (or other moist locales) except during heavy rainfall or thunderstorms, when they find shelter deep beneath the ground in caverns, caves or crypts in an attempt to stay dry.

monster.name: Frightful Spirit
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Ephemeral
entries: The spirit can't wear or carry anything.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The spirit doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Haunting Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) psychic damage.

action.name: Frightful Howl
entries: The spirit releases a horrifying screech, forcing all creatures that can hear it to make a Wisdom saving throw ({@dc 13}) or take 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) psychic damage and become {@condition frightened} of the spirit. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the spirit is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the spirit's {@i Frightful Howl} for the next 24 hours.

Spirits are echos of a creature's soul after death. A spirit can manifest in many ways. Sometimes, they can be a wayward soul and maintain personality and coherent thought. However, most spirits are just shreds of a soul that can be seen as the pure essence of emotion or trauma. Unlike other ephemeral undead such as {@creature ghost||ghosts}, these type of spirits most often do not seem to possess any type of coherent intelligence.

entries.name: Frightful Spirit
entries: Borne of the strongest dread and fear, the {@i frightful spirit} preys on the fears of the living. They are also known as {@i haunting spirits}, and can be recognized by their intense wailing. People who have encountered a frightful spirit sometimes recall seeing the visage of their deepest fear, rather than the spirit itself. A frightful spirit is extremely erratic and will move and attack seemingly at random when encountered in battle.

entries.name: Spiteful Spirit
entries: A {@creature spiteful spirit|ba} is best left alone, and will generally ignore adventurers who do so. Spiteful spirits will hurt anyone (or anything) that hurts them, and are known to focus their ire on the first creature who attacks them. This kind of spirit is known to flee direct confrontation, stalking their attacker until a more opportune moment. It is extremely important to be rid of spiteful spirits—that is, if you appreciate sleeping soundly.

entries.name: Vengeful Spirit
entries: Preying on the weak and looking to hurt whoever they can, the {@creature vengeful spirit|ba} is an aggressive spirit that will strike out at any creatures who come near. They usually roam in places such as long-forgotten battlefields or sites of dishonorable conduct. In battle they will often turn their attention to the latest source of harm because of this, without regard for any other creatures or dangers that may stand between them and their target.

monster.name: Spiteful Spirit
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Ephemeral
entries: The spirit can't wear or carry anything.

trait.name: Essence of Spite
entries: A creature that attacks or ends its turn within 5 feet of the spirit takes 5 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) psychic damage.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Psychic Spike
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d4 + 3}) psychic damage.

However, most spirits are just shreds of a soul that can be seen as the pure essence of emotion or trauma. In battle they will often turn their attention to the latest source of harm because of this, without regard for any other creatures or dangers that may stand between them and their target.

monster.name: Vengeful Spirit
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Ephemeral
entries: The spirit can't wear or carry anything.

trait.name: Essence of Vengeance
entries: When a creature attacks the spirit, they must make a Wisdom saving throw ({@dc 13}). On a failed save, the next attack made against that creature is made with advantage.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Vengeful Spike
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d4 + 3}) necrotic damage.

They usually roam in places such as long-forgotten battlefields or sites of dishonorable conduct. In battle they will often turn their attention to the latest source of harm because of this, without regard for any other creatures or dangers that may stand between them and their target.

monster.name: Spirit Caller
languages: any two languages (usually Common and one other)

trait.name: Spirit Ward
entries: The spirit caller can use a bonus action to sacrifice one spirit they have summoned using their {@i Summon Spirit} ability to increase their AC to 16 for 8 hours.

trait.name: Censer of the Afterlife
entries: All hostile undead creatures within 10 feet of the spirit caller have disadvantage on all saving throws.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The spirit caller is a 9th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The spirit caller has following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spirit caller makes two attacks with their {@i Censer Flail}.

action.name: Censer Flail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Summon Spirit {@recharge 4}
entries: The spirit caller summons one spirit. The spirit caller can sacrifice a piece of themselves to select a specific spirit (taking {@damage 1d4 - 1} necrotic damage), or you can roll to determine the spirit summoned randomly on the table below.
The spirit caller can use a bonus action to command any or all of the spirits they have summoned. The summoned spirit takes its turn directly after the spirit caller in the initiative order.

The spirit caller can summon up to 10 spirits per long rest, and can have a maximum of six spirits summoned at any given time. Attempting to summon another spirit will cause the least recently summoned spirit to break free of the spirit caller's control and become hostile toward them.

A spirit caller calls upon wayward spirits to aid them in battle. They walk a fine line between necromancy and divinity. Some of them worship deities, while others seek power for themselves. In some cultures they are respected as conduit to the spirits and the afterlife, but in others they are feared for their connection to death and the undead.

entries.name: Spirits from Beyond
entries: Although little is known about the spirits that a spirit caller commands, it is generally believed that they are manifestations of damaged souls. Spirit callers possess the power to command these spirits so they may finally find peace in the afterlife when they perish.

trait.name: Plague Aura
entries: When any creature that isn't a fiend starts its turn within 15 feet of one or more vrelock, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, taking 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage, plus 1 poison damage for each vrelock within 15 feet of them.

trait.name: Diseased Hold
entries: If a creature is {@condition grappled} by the vrelock (or the vrelock is grappled by a creature), the creature grappling or grappled by the vrelock takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) acid damage at the start of their turn.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The vrelock has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vrelock makes two attacks, one with with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) acid damage. On a successful hit, the target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition diseased|ba}.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

variant.name: Vrelock Disease Variants
entries: One vrelock can assimilate a number of different diseases. Instead of applying the {@condition diseased|ba} condition during a bite attack, you can use any other disease or condition of your choice. (For example, you can roll on {@table d100 Diseases|ba} for inspiration.)

Although vrelocks are considered lesser demons, they are widely regarded as the heralds of plague and disease. Their bites can infect other creatures with various ailments, and even standing near one of these creatures can be dangerous for your wellbeing.

entries.name: Plague of Demons
entries: Vrelocks are commonly encountered in larger packs (usually a half-dozen to a dozen). Their strength lies in their numbers. In the wars of the Lower Planes they are often dispatched (and sacrificed) for the sole purpose of afflicting the opposing force with a plague, reducing their strength.

entries.name: Disease Hoarders
entries: Vrelocks thrive on disease and rot. They assimilate sickness by consuming the flesh of diseased creatures. They then become the vector for this disease and are able to transfer it to their next victim, regardless of original vector. Surviving the initial attack from a pack of vrelocks is not the most important problem; Surviving the diseases they may have carried is perhaps a bigger ordeal.

trait.name: Permanent Slave
entries: The wrentuix can perform a one-hour ritual on an undead servant they gained through a spell (such as {@spell animate dead}). The ritual causes the undead servant to remain in the service of the wrentuix indefininetly, regardless of any time constraints outlined in the spell.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wrentuix is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wrentuix makes three attacks with its claws if it is holding a staff, or four if it is not holding a staff.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

The six-limbed fey creatures known as the wrentuix can often be found scampering through the snow-covered pine forests and across the frozen tundras of the realms. They are solitary creatures but often bend other beings to their will.

Wrentuix are deeply interested in the dark arts of necromancy. They are often encountered with a few reanimated corpses in their service. When they do not have such servants, they are most likely seeking an unfortunate creature to make a fresh corpse.

entries.name: Thieves and Tricksters
entries: Wrentuix are infamous for their trickery. They covet magical staffs and wands more than anything, and often try to steal such items to use as their spellcasting focus. A Wrentuix that does not have a spellcasting focus will try its best to steal one from a waylaid wizard or sorcerer.

subclassFeature.name: Born from Disease
entries: As a Plagueborn sorcerer your innate magic comes from a disease in your bloodline or a disease you encountered during your lifetime. Where others have perished from it, you instead draw power from the disease running through your veins. Perhaps a great plague left no one in your city alive but you or you were experimented on by a mad scientist. Whatever happened to you, it enabled you to unlock and develop magical powers. When creating a Plagueborn sorcerer, consider what kind of disease affects or has affected you and how your survival has shaped your life.

subclassFeature.name: Vigor of the Blood
entries: {@i 1st-level Plagueborn feature}
Your blood causes you to be impervious to any sickness. Starting at 1st level you are immune to disease.

subclassFeature.name: Blight Bringer
entries: {@i 1st-level Plagueborn feature}

Starting at 1st level you gain access to an expanded spell list. These spells are considered Sorcerer spells for you. You gain access to additional Plagueborn spells on different levels. You can choose one of these spells whenever you learn new sorcerer spells.

entries.caption: Plagueborn Expanded Spell List
rows: {@spell detect poison and disease}, {@spell inflict wounds}, {@spell ray of sickness}
{@spell feign death}, {@spell life transference|xge}, {@spell vampiric touch}

subclassFeature.name: Aegis Miasma
entries: Your innate magic causes you to be affected less by harmful substances. At 6th level you gain resistance to acid and poison damage.

subclassFeature.name: Infectious Magic
entries: Starting at 14th level when you cast a spell, you may change the damage type to acid or poison. You may change a spell's damage type up to a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all uses when you finish a long rest. Additionaly, when you cast a spell that deals acid or poison damage you may re-roll all damage dice you rolled a 2 or lower on. You must take the second roll, even if it is the same or lower.

subclassFeature.name: Virulent Mutation
entries: Starting at 18th level you have gained mastery over your disease or ailment. As a bonus action you can strengthen yourself for a short amount of time by utilizing the disease in your body. When you do this, your eyes turn toxic green and your blood turns black, and you become immune to acid and poison damage.

While this feature is active, each spell you cast that deals acid or poison damage ignores resistance and immunity to damage of the given type. When a creature is hit by any ranged or melee spell attack you make, they must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC, becoming {@condition poisoned} for 10 minutes on a failed save. They can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the condition on a success.
This effect lasts for 10 minutes. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

table.name: d100 Character Traits
table.caption: Character Traits
rows: A hurried and stressed person, they end their sentences in a slightly higher pitch or a questioning tone.
Easily distracted by mundane things but they always have a cheerful attitude.
An arrogant coward with a royal background, They flaunt their wealth a lot.
Twitchy and nervous. they are easily scared or jolted by mundane things.
A grumpy and discontent individual they always seems to be holding in their anger.
A charming person that always has a compliment for a friend.
Fearless but not very bright, tends to settle arguments with their fists.
Cunning and sly, easily offended when it comes to their wealth.
Cheerful and hyperactive. They almost always have a smile on their face.
Silent and thoughtful. Speaks slowly and uses a minimal amount of words.
Mischievous but with a heart of gold. Would never hurt anyone. Teases people a lot.
Loud and unapologetic. Often makes rude comments and farts a lot. Usually laughs it off.
Often sad, they try to see the good things in bad situations but have a hard time doing so.
A stoic individual, they always rationalize their feelings. They can see most things objectively.
Satisfied and settled down, they are comfortable and happy where they are right now.
Impatient, they are easily irritated by ignorant or slow people. They often tell people to hurry up.
Traumatized by events they experienced, they will stop at nothing to get revenge.
An expressive individual, they talk with their hands and hug others as a form of greeting.
Often under the influence of narcotics, they are always looking for their next fix.
Suspicious, they do not easily trust others. They whisper when talking, so others don't hear.
Easily angered when they see other people getting hurt, protective of those close to them.
Energetic, constantly tapping their feet or fingers. They often can't wait to do something new.
A young and childish soul that has a sense of wonder for anything. They have a little skip in their step.
A weak and diseased individual, they cough after almost every sentence they speak.
Wise beyond their years, they often give advice to others. They speak with a lot of confidence.
Demanding, they require others to do as they are told, they do not take no for an answer.
Charitable, they often share their food and drink with others. Always willing to help out a friend.
Jealous, they wish to get higher up in the world to show off to others.
Observing and quiet, they wait until someone approaches them. They know quite a lot about others.
A bumbling idiot, they say anything that crosses their mind. They speak before they (try to) think.
Shy and apologetic, apologizes and excuses themselves every other sentence.
Kind and welcoming; would make an excellent innkeep if it weren't for their greed.
Ignorant towards the value of currency, finds happiness in simple things.
Thinks everyone is better than them, very insecure.
Does not care what others think of them, dresses and speaks accordingly.
Very bright and intelligent but talents wasted through substance abuse.
Very flirty but almost never engages in any romantic affairs.
An old soul, they are convinced they are very wise but not everyone would agree.
Makes decisions based on the people around him, easily persuaded, could not live without spouse.
Has been hunting a specific creature for years and is thoroughly obsessed with it.
Knows the adventurers by name and has heard of their deeds but is not impressed.
Fidgets with their fingers a lot, can not stay still for even a second.
A very warm parental figure, they are an important part of the community they live in.
A calm individual, not easily jolted or angered. They are hard to intimidate.
Has no patience, they still have a lot to do today and their time will not be wasted.
Angered easily by foolish or childish behavior, does not appreciate jokes.
Completely in love with another individual, will not accept a bad remark about that person.
Uncharismatic but loved by many, his demeanor is extremely kind but very awkward.
Jokes constantly about the stupidity of others but often trips over their own feet.
Scared to death of Dragonborn, they have had a traumatic experience with a dragon.
Very vain and focused on looks, runs hands through their hair/beard often.
Has bad eyesight, does not respond to any visually alarming things.
Claims they come from royalty and act as such, however, nobody knows their heritage.
A liar and a cheat, will do anything for a gold coin, does not like to spend money.
A hulking individual for their race, they are strong but very stupid.
They are very mean to people that are not their gender.
Almost always happy, prefers to skip instead of walk, their pockets are stuffed with candy.
Grim and somber, they are rarely seen in bright daylight and prefer darkness.
Would love to be an adventurer, easily impressed by magical displays of any kind.
Angry with the leadership of their community, blames everything on them.
A gentle person, they feel most at home in the wild, walks barefoot.
A kind and artistic person, they have a sketchbook with them at all times.
A typical scholar, when relaying information they often refer to some book they have read.
A charismatic and pleasant person, they have many valuable connections in the community.
A classless person, they often burp or fart without apologizing.
They have big dreams about becoming renowned and famous with their trade.
A hard worker they practice and toil deep into the night, making them very tired.
Straightforward and to the point, does not care about pleasantries.
Has a bad leg, walks slow but they tough it out without complaint.
They have a dual personality, they are complete opposites in terms of likes and dislikes.
Claims they see the future in their dreams, but they claim it after events have passed.
Wears masks to hide their face, their masks show their emotional state of that day.
Is extremely proud of their kid(s), talks about them a lot.
Clumsy, they often drop things they are handed and when walking bump into other people.
Optimistic, they quite often see a silver lining to a bad situation.
Indifferent, they do not care about a lot of things that others care about.
Pessimistic, they see the worst in the best of things.
Lives by the law and some of their own rules, some of which are a bit weird.
Does not trust people they have not met yet.
Curious, they has a profound interest in the origins of one of the adventurers.
Battles narcolepsy, sometimes falls asleep or dozes off mid sentence.
Has to do some actions and say some things five times in sequence.
Has a hard time believing there is any sort of evil in the world until they see it themselves.
Friendly but quite often judges peoples' worth by their clothing and jewelry.
Forgetful, they often forget people's names, faces but also details about their surroundings.
Creepy, they often stand a little too close for comfort to others without reason.
Diva, they can and shall not live without preposterous luxuries.
Reserved, they keep their emotions in check even in great danger.
Extremely friendly to small humanoids, they have a soft spot for the small folk.
Friendly and very talented but brush off any praise they receive for what they do.
They love to take a bet, they have made a lot of money with it as well.
Easily distracted but they are fascinated and captivated by shiny objects.
Chaotic in their demeanor, they hoard one certain type of furniture in their dwelling.
A careless individual, they love walking in the rain.
Adopted by a different race as a child they have different customs than could be expected.
Extremely lazy they do not care to do any work if it is not necessary.
Very distrustful, they have wild conspiracy theories about things happening in their community.
Indecisive, they doubt themselves a lot, they often change clothing and hairstyle.
Unnervingly sweet in their demeanor, says the most horrible things with a smile.
Slightly unhinged, they can suddenly respond quite extreme or emotional without reason.

table.name: d100 Drinking Toasts
table.caption: Drinking Toasts
rows: Here's to the ditch, may it be warm and cozy when we end up there later tonight.
Here's to cheating, stealing, and drinking. May you cheat death, steal hearts, and always drink with me.
May you have warm words on a cold evening, a full moon on a dark night and the road downhill all the way to your door.
Here's to [drink], the cause of, and solution to all life's problems.
Whilst the hearth is still aglow, let the [drink] flow!
Here's to my middlefinger, for always sticking up for me when I needed it most.
To the king, the queen, or whoever rules these bloody lands.
And to those who embrace the night early, we mourn their weak wills and pray for those lonely souls
Here's to doing and drinking, not sitting and thinking.
Cheers, for the liver is evil and must be punished tonight.
If I should stumble out this bar, I hope the night is worth the scar
Here's to those who will have to clean up the mess we leave.
Here's to being single, drinking doubles, and seeing triple.
Over the teeth, over the gums, look out stomach here it comes.
Here's to [drink], not as good as (wo)men, but pretty close.
Drink until the sun comes up, drink until the sun goes down, if you drink on both occassions you will never frown.
Tonight, the only thing I worry about is turning [drink] into piss.
It matters not if the glass is half empty or half full, clearly there's room for more!
Here's to your nose, here's to your chin,here's to the hole, in-between it goes in!
One beer, two beers, three beers, four, still depressed? Drink some more.
As you slide down the banister of life, may the splinters never face the wrong way.
A toast to bread, for without bread, there would be no toast.
Time is never wasted, when you're wasted all the time.
May I alwayss be remembered for what I have done, not what I'm about to do.
I can't find the words that go well with this drink, perhaps they're at the bottom of the glass. Cheers!
I would like to thank my arms for always being by my side, my legs for always supporting me, and my fingers, because I can always count on them.
Lift em high and drain em dry, here's to the person who says "my turn to buy"!
Pain makes you stronger. Tears make you braver. Heartbreak makes you wiser. And [drink] makes you remember none of that.
To mighty fights, wilds nights, and the clink of good coin in our purses!
Let our drinks be full, our spirits hearty, and our blades sharp!
Another day another bender, no retreat no surrender.
To the confusion of our enemies!
More poison, there's things inside me that need killing!
Here's to us! May we live respected and die regretted.
To good luck and taking chances!
May the saddest day of your future, be no worse than the happiest day of your past.
To those who guide us through darkness into light.
Here's to Dame Fortune; may she smile upon you and may you never meet her daughter, Miss Fortune
Life is a waste of time, and time is a waste of life. So let's get wasted all of the time, and have the time of our life.
Life is a jest and all things show it, I thought so once and now I know it.
For every wound, a balm. For every sorrow, cheer. For every storm, a calm. For every thirst, a beer.
Here's to a long life and a happy one. A quick death and an easy one. A good love and an honest one. A cold drink and another one.
May the winds of fortune sail you, may you sail a gentle sea. May it always be the other guy, who says, "this drink's on me.
May misfortune follow you the rest of your life, but never catch up.
May sweet laughter lighten every load. May the spark of arcane magic shorten every road. And may all your friends remember all the favours you are owed!
May you have the hindsight to know where you've been, foresight to know where you're going, and insight to know when you've gone too far
May we get what we want, but never what we deserve.
I drank to your health in company. I drank to your health alone. I drank to your health so many times, I nearly ruined my own.
May we suffer as much sorrow as drops of wine we are about to leave in our glasses!
Always remember to forget the things that made you sad, never forget to remember the things that made you glad.
May we all have the chance to to prove that money does not make you happy.
May your copper turn to gold and your silvers turn to platinum.
May you live as long as you like, and have all you like as long as you live.
A rich man lives in a castle, a poor man lives by the sea. But a whiskey glass and a nice round ass are home sweet home to me.
Health to those I love, wealth to those who love me.
A round to the best, may we never get less than we deserve and more than we may ever need
May our children have wealthy parents.
May your heart be light and happy, may your smile be big and wide and may your pockets always have a coin or two inside!
Steal my gold that's all right, steal my drink you'll get a fight!
A toast to [deity] for [drink] is proof that [deity] loves us and wants us to be happy!
May neighbors respect you, trouble neglect you. Angels protect you and heaven accept you.
May you be in heaven a full half hour before the devil knows you're dead.
To [deity] may they bless these people!
May you always lie, cheat, and steal. Lie beside the one you love, cheat the devil, and steal away from bad company.
To the skies, may we fall long before they do!
Here's to hell: May the stay there be as fun as the way there.
Here's to the night's we won't remember, with the friends we'll never forget.
Here's to those who wish us well, all the rest can go to hell.
To ourselves, as no one is likely to concern themselves with our welfare.
Here's to those who wish us well, all the rest can go to hell.
I would rather be here, with the people in this room, than with the best people in the world!
To making friends in new places!
To those who've seen us at our worst and seen us at our best, and cannot tell the difference.
To family that are friends, and to friends that are family!
Here's to the friends who love us, the losers that lost us and the lucky ones yet to meet us!
Here's to you and here's to me, and if by chance we disagree, to hell with you! And here's to me!
There are good ships, there are wood ships, and ships that sail the sea. But the best ships, are friendships, And may they always be.
Let us raise our drinks in honor of those who came before, and those who are soon to come. To good health, my friends, and a good night to you all.
May the roof above these friends never fall in, and may the friends beneath this roof never fall out.
I don't care what those others say, you people are all right!
Friends may come and friends may go, but [drink] is here to soothe the blow.
If I die before you, raise a glass in my name. If you go before me I'll do the same
Cheers, to whomever loves us even though we may not deserve it.
Here's to roses and lilies in bloom, you in my arms, and me in your room. A door that is locked, a key that is lost and a night that is 50 years long.
Cheers to beers and legs behind your ears.
To not knowing left from right and hoping I'm not left and end up all right!
A drink, to whoever your heart beats for.
May we kiss who we please, and please who we kiss
Here is to the girl on the hill, that says she won't but her sister will. (boy/his brother, person, their sibling)
May all your ups and downs be under the covers!
To sweet love, a long life and a lousy liver!
With this glass, rich, and deep, we cradle our sorrows to sleep.
To the fallen, may they guide our hearts and our blades!
Here's to getting out alive where others did not.
I raise a glass to the fallen, for I am thankful to drink with those that remain standing.
Tonight we'll drown our sorrow untill we remember them on the morrow.

table.name: d100 Voice Acting References
table.caption: Voices
rows: Speaks fast with a small lisp
Relaxed with a lot of contented humming
Puts emphasis on the wrong part of words
Loud with a lot of bravado
Notes of animalistic growling and snarling
Inhaling and exhaling with a thin wheeze
Speaks in the back of the mouth
Speaks like royalty, uses complex vocabulary
Vocalizes in the front of the mouth
Tuts and clicks tongue a lot
Adds syllables to words to emphasize
Speaks like their tongue is numb
Speaks with their lower jaw jutted out
Keeps vowels as short as possible
Low rumbling, the words strung together
Speaks in third person about themselves
Switches between two types of voices
Mumbles notes to self in between sentences
Draws out most vowels when speaking
Speaks as if they have a cold/blocked nose
Often spits out words with contempt
Uses the words/sounds "uh" and "uhm" a lot

table.name: d100 Slightly Magical Trinkets
table.caption: Magical Trinkets
rows: A wooden statuette of a cat that purrs softly when you pet it.
A four leaf clover preserved in a large amber that glows soflty in the dark.
A charred {@item flute|phb} which emits smoke when played.
Bootlaces that tie themselves when commanded to do so.
A coin that changes to either gold or silver depending on which face it lands on when flipped.
A pan which does not require grease to cook in and magically seasons the food to perfection.
A piece of cloth that can clean the rust off of any metal with one wipe.
A music box which can record 1 minute of music played by an instrument.
An intricately-carved {@creature troglodyte} skull that hums a sad tune.
A soft leather {@item pouch|phb} with fancy gold numbers that show how many gold pieces are inside of it.
A playing card that changes its face whenever it is tapped in a specific way.
An ice cube that never melts.
A {@item shortsword|phb} that softly sobs and whines whenever it is touched.
A quill that writes down all the words it is dictated.
A book that changes its contents to a different children's story every week.
A painting showing a nature scene. Birds fly across the scene in the painting every now and then.
A bag which sighs as if annoyed whenever you put an item in it.
A key that will only open the lock it can unlock when asked kindly.
A canvas {@item two-person tent|phb|tent} that takes on the color of its surroundings when pitched.
A crystal goblet that bounces instead of shattering whenever it is dropped.
A {@item bedroll|phb} which can be folded to fit inside your pocket.
A {@item hooded lantern|phb|lantern} that ignites by itself whenever the sun goes down.
A seashell which, when left undisturbed, moves 1 inch toward the nearest ocean or sea each day.
A pair of glasses without temples that hover in the air just in front of the face.
A comb which changes the hair it combs to a random color.
A needle which magically mends rips and tears in clothing and fabrics as per the {@spell mending} cantrip.
A purple rose that never wilts.
A drinking glass that can only be filled up to half full. {@italic (Or half empty depending on your views)}.
A bag of blue marbles. Each of them hums in a soft harmonious tone when rolled.
A compass that always points to the closest rabbit.
A {@item torch|phb} that is always wet and dripping. It only ignites when submerged in salt water.
A six-sided die that announces the number it rolled in a soft spoken lady's voice.
A harp that sounds like a flute when played.
A glass {@item orb|phb} with swirling mists inside.
A spinning top which sparks with harmless electricity when spun.
A {@item shortbow|phb} which says "miss" in a monotone gnomish voice whenever you miss your target.
A glass birdcage that amplifies or silences the song of any birds within.
A coin {@item pouch|phb} that always sounds and feels as if it is full of coins as long as there is at least one coin inside.
A snowglobe that causes snow to fall for a few seconds in a 5-foot radius when you shake it.
A dark blue eraser which is able to erase non-magical ink from paper.
An envelope that can only be opened without magical means by the person it is adressed to.
A cloak that always seems to billow dramatically as if caught in the wind.
A pair of glasses that allow the wearer to read a random language. The language changes each day.
A quill that never runs out of ink.
A gold ring that turns to silver when on the finger of a creature that is cursed.
Parchment that burns to ashes after anything written on it is read by anyone other than the writer.
A {@item hammer|phb} that makes no noise when used to forge metal.
A cooking pot that stirs itself when commanded to do so.
A cheese knife that turns into a living mouse for 1 hour when it comes into contact with cheese.
A metal plate that heats up any regular-sized pot or kettle that is placed on top of it.
A stone that laughs whenever someone makes a joke nobody laughed at.
A {@item candle|phb} that has a green flame when lit.
A stone tablet which predicts weather conditions for the next 3 days through glowing runes.
A {@item riding saddle|phb} that summons a magical ladder to allow a small humanoid to easily mount the creature it is on.
Fancy boots that magically change color to fit the color scheme of the rest of the outfit.
Curtains that open and close when commanded to do so.
A key that crumbles to dust after it unlocks the lock it belongs to.
A 1 inch, solid silver cube that removes non-magical tattoos when rubbed on the tattooed skin.
A stuffed bear that tells bedtime stories to the creature holding it.
A hat that flies and settles on a random head within 30 feet when thrown.
A platinum disc that emits a shrill tone whenever it senses smoke.
A linen bag that washes and dries all the clothes put in it over the course of an hour.
A scarf that changes the voice of the creature wearing it.
A mug that chills any type of ale that is poured into it to the perfect temperature.
A small stone owl that turns its head toward a creature when they cast a spell.
A pirate's flag that can magically display the colors of a faraway nation instead.
A dark red book that keeps a tally count all the creatures the owner has killed.
A navy blue wooden box. Once per day when it is opened, a butterfly flies out of it.
An enchanted brick which is under the effects of {@spell feather fall} only when nothing is touching it.
A towel that clears acne and removes small scars when rubbed on the skin.
A small terracotta pot which fills up with a new mix of herbs and spices every day.
A bit and bridle that temporarily changes the color of the horse to pure white.
A small brass bell that rings every morning one hour past sunrise. The sound is loud enough to wake a creature.
A feather duster which dusts objects by itself when commanded to do so.
A glass ornament that changes its shape into a different fruit every day.
A lace fan that, when unfolded, floats in mid-air and softly fans.
A silver bracelet in the shape of a snake that slowly curls and moves around the arm.
A board that hovers 2 inches above the ground and supports the weight of a medium-sized creature.
A cast iron pan that floats on water.
A holy symbol which recites the beliefs or tenets of the deity it belongs to on command.
An hourglass in which the sand flows upwards.
An ocarina made of bone that when played sounds as if a quartet of ocarinas is being played.
Porcelain plates that clean and stack themselves after being used.
A spherical crystal that displays a swirling galaxy inside.
A fishing hook that always smells of fish. When submerged in water it secretes a few drops of blood.
An eyeball in a bottle. The color of the iris changes depending on which plane of existence it is on.
A quill that can write smokey markings in mid-air. The markings disappear after 1 hour or if blown away.
A leather-bound book in which all illustrations made inside it become slightly animated.
A purple vial with a glass stopper that when opened a wisp of lavender incense smoke comes out.
A small golden fork that turns into a spoon when tapped against any surface.
A silver knight chess piece that whinnies softly when stroked.
Gloves made of white silk that become black for 1 hour if they come into direct contact with poison.
A clay spinning top in the shape of a dancing woman that soflty sings a sad song when spun.
A small glass terrarium that magically grows few tiny strawberries every day.
A square glass vial that when filled with salt water turns the water to salt over the course of a day.
A solid gold lockpick that whispers "jackpot" when it successfully opens a lock.
A fishing rod that can magically turn into a walking cane.
A small square painting that turns into a mirror when any creature comes within 1 foot of it.
Fancy clothes that neatly fold themselves when taken off and left undisturbed for 1 minute.
An arcane powered watch which displays the time, date (if any) and the plane of existence it is on.
